CatDescriptText: Betty Proctor, 7643 Mulford Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "Pay as you go is better than paying out a lump sum of money, because you just don't have the money in one amount when it is due."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Betty Proctor wearing light colored coat with three buttons and light colored patterned head scarf, standing with small child behind her, in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
